articles.title: AI in Healthcare: Transforming Diagnosis, Treatment, and Patient Care

articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is revolutionizing healthcare by improving diagnosis, treatment, and patient care. The integration of AI in healthcare necessitates addressing crucial ethical concerns such as protecting patient data privacy, protecting algorithms from bias, and maintaining transparency. This article explores the key areas where AI is transforming healthcare, focusing on the use of machine learning and deep learning.

articles.title: War Room's Steve Bannon and Joe Allen on the Dangers of AI Dependence – 'We Are Set Up for Basically a Kind of Drone Like Existence' (VIDEO)

articles.title: Tim Cook reportedly tells employees Apple ‘must' win in AI

The meeting came after an earnings call in which Cook promised to increase its AI investments. OpenAI has 3 million paying enterprise customers and $10 billion in annual recurring revenue (ARR).

articles.title: OpenAI ends ChatGPT users' option to index chats on search engines
articles.author: Mike Heuer
articles.summary: OpenAI is ending the option to have Google and other search engines index user chats with ChatGPT and make the content of those chats discoverable on searches. articles.summary: 85% of APAC organizations overestimate their actual maturity in AI and Industry 4.0 capabilities, according to a new study commissioned by IBM. This is despite increasing investments in AI in Asia-Pacific (APAC) and increasing awareness of AI's capabilities.

articles.title: A.I. Is Shedding Enlightenment Values
articles.summary: Enthusiasts claim that artificial intelligence will bring about an intellectual revolution as profound as the Enlightenment. articles.title: Saturday Hashtag: #SyntheticFraudCrisis
articles.author: Sean Ogden
articles.summary: In 2024, 1.2 million AI-generated 'ghost students' applied to California community colleges. They completed paperwork, passed ID checks, submitted assignments, and triggered disbursements. At least $11.1 million in aid was stolen this way. Bots give the false impression that classes are filled, blocking real students. Professors have to open sessions by verifying that students are human. Schools lose funding when bots mass-drop. Employers are hiring ghosts and leaking trade secrets.

articles.title: Fragmented state-level artificial intelligence policies will hinder its potential

articles.summary: Brett Finley is president and CEO of the Metro SA Chamber. Texas passed House Bill 149 with strong bipartisan support and Gov. Greg Abbott signed it in June. It encourages innovation and ensures that future regulation is targeted, inclusive and designed to support growth. California's proposed AI laws are vague and overly broad.

In each case, they were told whether the message was written by a human or by AI. Participants who believed a human wrote the press release found it more credible and effective.

articles.title: ChatGPT Conversations Exposed: Google Search Reveals Private Chats
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: ChatGPT conversations with the AI chatbot were being indexed by Google and appearing in search results. This meant sensitive personal information, business strategies, and other confidential data shared during ChatGPT sessions were potentially accessible to anyone performing a targeted Google search. The issue stemmed from OpenAI's robots.txt file, which initially didn't prevent Google from crawling and indexing URLs containing chat content. This led to a widespread exposure of user data, raising important data privacy concerns. OpenAI took several steps to address the issue.

articles.author: The Verge
articles.summary: Apple CEO Tim Cook boasted about the potential of AI and the company's approach to developing it in a rare all-hands today. Apple has been slow to roll out some of its AI features and has stumbled with a planned AI-powered upgrade to Siri, which it delayed earlier this year.

articles.title: Cognitive decline
articles.author: Dawn
articles.summary: The rapid integration of AI tools like ChatGPT into our daily lives is a double-edged sword. It is crucial to examine their potential impact on our cognitive abilities. A recent study found that large language models (LLMs) can be harmful to cognitively impaired people.

articles.title: How US adults are interacting with AI
articles.author: Matt O Brien
articles.summary: Most U.S. adults use artificial intelligence to search for information, but fewer are using it for work, drafting email or shopping. Younger adults are most likely to be using AI for brainstorming and work tasks. About 4 in 10 Americans say they use AI for work tasks at least sometimes. About one-quarter use it to shop.

articles.title: China pushes global AI pact
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: Li Qiang wants world leaders to form an international artificial intelligence body to address the growing risks associated with the technology and to prevent a small number of countries or companies from dominating the field, according to a Bloomberg report as posted by Joseph Waring, Asia editor for Bloomberg.

articles.title: A.I. Is Not a 21st-Century Enlightenment
articles.author: New York Times
articles.summary: A historian sees the dangerous parallels between artificial intelligence and the Enlightenment, as well as the potential dangers of its development, according to the historian. The historian claims that artificial intelligence could be dangerous in the future, as it is not controllable.

articles.title: Geisinger launches artificial intelligence-enabled breast cancer screening program
articles.summary: Geisinger has begun using a new artificial intelligence-enabled breast cancer screening program to identify high-risk patients and refer them for appropriate care. Research shows that early detection of breast cancer can lead to a 99% 5-year survival rate. For more information about comprehensive breast cancer care at Geisinger visit geisinger.org/breastcare.
